byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Donald J Trump clash repeatedly and antagonistically in their first debate, arguing over Iraq war, trade, his refusal to release his tax returns and her use of private email server; Trump attacks Clinton on trade, while she counters with his fitness; vitriolic and vigorous debate, with up 100 million viewers, is surreal at times.

headline.print_headline: Candidates Press Pointed Attacks in Acerbic Debate
headline.main: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Press Pointed Attacks in Debate

snippet: In the first general-election debate, Mr. Trump criticized Mrs. Clinton on trade and her email practices, and she called him unfit to be commander in chief....
lead_paragraph: In the first general-election debate, Mr. Trump criticized Mrs. Clinton on trade and her email practices, and she called him unfit to be commander in chief.
